results.title: Cowboy and Maria in town
results.creator_credit: Annie Stiven, Les McLaren, Australian Film Commission and Vingan
results.brief_description: Attracted by the myths of town life, and the chance of work, people from villages all over Papua New Guinea have come to the towns. This documentary tells the story of two such migrants living in the settlements that surround the Capital Port Moresby. Cowboy is a reformed ‘rascal’ who plays rock and roll on a homemade guitar in the street earning just enough for his family to get by. Maria lives an equally precarious existence. Seasonal gardening, and her husband’s small income as a night security guard are their means of survival. Cowboy and Maria are vital players in the new urban Papua New Guinea. Their interwoven stories highlight the consequences of urban drift, where traditional and Western values meet.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Annie Stiven, Les McLaren, Australian Film Commission and Vingan

results.title: Outback supply
results.creator_credit: David Haythornthwaite, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Frontiers downunder”.
John Thomas operates the outback supply truck from Tibooburra northwest NSW. He periodically delivers mail and all types of supplies to people on outlying sheep and cattle stations. Often he takes his four year old son Normie along with him on his mail-run. Cinematography by Dean Semler. Edited by Nick Torrens.

results.title: Country Outcasts
results.creator_credit: David Roberts, Peter Johnson and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Frontiers downunder”.
Country outcasts is a small pop band made up from a number of talented Aborigines who have spent their lives in a wholly urbanised environment. This film is the story of a tour that this band makes through the outback, and the thoughts and feelings that are aroused within these city dwellers when they meet their trivialised brothers in Central Australia.

results.title: Frontiers downunder
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Frontiers downunder”.
The first in a series of six films depicting life in Australia in the late 1970’s. It is a compilation of some of the footage and subject matter of the other five films, and is a very brief look at the complexities that go to make up this huge southland - the largest island in the world. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Urban mixtures
results.creator_credit: Martin Cohen, Peter Johnson and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Frontiers downunder”.
Four migrants talk about their adjustments to, and attitudes towards, Australian society. Although they are from different economic backgrounds, each has some involvement in migrant community, through social work, ethnic radio, and the ethnic community council.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Martin Cohen, Peter Johnson and Film Australia

results.title: G'day sport
results.creator_credit: David Roberts, Peter Johnson and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Frontiers downunder”.
A slightly different look at a nation that is apparently “sports mad”. This malady and the sort of sporting competition need for most Australians is examined, as well as the extremes that people in the outback go to in order to satisfy their competitive needs

results.title: Sky bridges
results.creator_credit: Greg Reading, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Frontiers downunder”.
The story of three men who fly around outback Australia to do their particular type of work. Dr Ian Robertson works for the Royal Flying Doctor Service, Tony Matthews is an Anglican Archdeacon with the Carpentaria Aerial Mission and Mervyn Moriarty is an artist teaching art with the Australian Flying Art School. Commentator: Tim Eliott
results.creator_credit_for_label: Greg Reading, Don Murray and Film Australia

results.title: Crane Island
results.creator_credit: Raymond Garceau, Leonard Frost and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A visit to one of the many tiny islands in the St. Lawrence River. Flocks of snow geese and other migratory birds, annually attract hundreds of sportsmen. Accompanies a party of visiting hunters as they bring down a plentiful bag. Shows the daily life of the French Canadian inhabitants who find a hardy but wholesome existence on the island’s bountiful lowland.
